name: Contig overlap walking
short_description: COW takes a FASTA file and extracts the last sequence to use for extension. Given a specified pattern length (P), this number of bases are chopped from the end of the FASTA sequence and used to pattern match in a FASTQ file (either fasta or fastq will work). When matches are found, the pattern and any preceeding sequence is removed, then the user defined k-mer length (L) is extracted from the remaining matches (from left to right). From these k-mers the frequency is then determined and the most frequent is selected as the best k-mer. The best k-mer is then concateneated to the original FASTA sequence and the next round begins.
